|Title=Know the definition and description of spondyloarthritis
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=1}}
- The concept of spondyloarthritis groups together chronic inflammatory rheumatic diseases that share common clinical manifestations and a common genetic background:

- Ankylosing spondylitis,

- psoriatic arthritis,

- reactive arthritis,

- arthritis associated with inflammatory enterocolopathies,

- juvenile forms,

- undifferentiated spondyloarthritis,

- and SAPHO syndrome.

- Terminology taken from the ASAS 2009 classification criteria

- Axial spondyloarthritis

- Radiographic = with radiographic sacroiliitis = ankylosing spondylitis.

- Non-radiographic = without radiographic sacroiliitis.

- '''Peripheral articular spondyloarthritis'''

- Erosive.

- Non-erosive.

- Enthesitic peripheral spondyloarthritis

properties.question: Which of the following is a correct description of spondyloarthritis according to the ASAS 2009 classification criteria?
properties.option_a: A rheumatic disease characterized by inflammation in the peripheral joints without radiographic evidence.
properties.option_b: A chronic inflammatory condition that primarily affects the axial skeleton and is associated with radiographic sacroiliitis.
properties.option_c: An acute inflammatory disorder that affects the skin and peripheral joints, typically resolving without treatment.
properties.option_d: A genetic disorder that leads to erosive changes in the peripheral joints, unrelated to inflammatory processes.
